Name: Coptic textile
Description: Fragment of a rectangular cloth, decorated with rows of meanders in purple alternating with tetralobate rosettes of the same colour, all on an unbleached ground. One of the borders ends in one red and one purple stripe, with a decoration of meanders in between. It is made on a type of loom which permitted the unlimited repetition of a decorative unit and the duplication of the same decoration on both the front and the back of the cloth.
